headline: Flax and Sunflower Seed Bread
description: This is a great bread for seed lovers, one of the tastiest I've tried.
name: Flax and Sunflower Seed Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Place all ingredients (except sunflower seeds) in the pan of the bread machine in the order recommended by the manufacturer. Select Basic White Cycle; press Start. Add the sunflower seeds when the alert sounds during the Knead Cycle.

review.reviewBody: I made this bread and it came out great! Thanks for the recipe!
Perfect recipe. I didn't have sunflower seeds, so just omitted them. Bread has a delicious, nutty taste. This is my new favorite bread recipe.
I enjoyed the taste and texture. However, the bread came out dense, didn't rise and was very heavy. Disappointed in the end result.
I use one cup all purpose and the rest whole wheat but still use basic loaf setting. Love it and it so moist and easy.
This bread is super easy to make. It taste great. I had no issues with it not rising. It was a little bit on the crumble side. I’m going to make more today and knead it a little longer. That may help

Perfect bread!! This is so simple and so tasty, with a slightly chewy texture, just like a seeded grain bread should have. I make no substitutions. I have also made this, though, by adding a cup of cranberries to change it up and it’s incredible. This is our favourite bread so far, out of a dozen recipes we’ve tried to date.
Bread is outstanding. Moist and flavorful. Only change I made was 1/4 cup sunflower seeds together with 1/4 cup baking cranberries

This is amazing bread! I’ve made it twice now. The first wheat recipe from a cookbook I tried was a huge fail. It didn’t rise at all. So, I read all 400+ reviews on this bread before I made it. My final decision was to make recipe and add 1 tbsp. Vital wheat gluten and 1 tbsp. Dough enhancer and an extra 1/2 tsp. salt. I used flax meal, not whole seeds. My bread machine directions are liquid first (I put the softened butter pieces and honey in 80 degree water, flour, flax meal , dry ingredients, then make a little pocket at the top for yeast, dough enhancer and vital wheat gluten. I couldn’t find the size setting in recipe so I went with 2 pound. I added the full amount of sunflower seeds after dough mixed for 10 mins. Perfection! I’ve even made it for neighbors now.
I love this recipe!!

This is becoming a family favorite. Today, I only had a little sunflower seed, so I subbed sesame seeds, about 1/2 cup. This makes a stiff dough that can be hard to knead, but it is so well worth the effort because the end result is a terrific tasting, hearty bread that slices beautifully, toasts really well, and freezes well. This may become the go-to bread that we use for every day, and not just special occasions.
I followed the recipe exactly and the result was perfect.
Loved it. Very tasty by itself or with a nice jam or butter. Yummy.

I did as some other reviewers suggested, and added a little bit of salt, and ground up the flax seeds. I also added in a tablespoon each of vital wheat gluten and dough enhancer. It was such a hit, I need to make another loaf tomorrow so we can enjoy it again!
We didn't have honey so we used molasses - absolutely phenomenal! Toast it and put a little butter on it! OMG!!!!
Absolutely perfect! Tastes wonderful and looks wonderful. I did add some rolled oats and substituted pumpkin seeds for the sunflower seeds; kept the amount of seeds at 1 cup altogether.

Made this bread today — a 2-lb loaf.
What a wonderful scent in our house as it baked! 
A really nice flavor, and fun with the little bit of crunchy from the seeds! 
We will absolutely make this over and over again!

I didn't have flax seed or wheat bread flour, so I used plain old wheat flour, and added an extra 1/4 tsp of yeast to compensate. I also added a 1/3 cup of finely chopped walnuts, and a 1/3 of a cup of dried cranberries. It makes a fantastic breakfast bread for toasting!

I made it once with whole wheat but since then have made it multiple times with a random mix of bread flour and all purpose flour. More bread flour than all purpose...but it has turned out fine everytime!! Also i fill 1 cup with ground flax, seasame, and chia seeds and let it run a little over and its great! one time i used sunflower another time i used pumpkin seeds instead...hard to screw up and hard to not eat it all at once! it doesnt have a great shelf-life but my boyfriend and i use it as a daily toast/sandwich bread so it doesnt last too long!
Omitted sunflower seeds
Very nice bread. Tasty and easy to make, added roasted garlic and it was just amazing.
Recipe was delicious! Only thing I’m tweaking for next time’s run would be taking it out of the bread maker 10-15 minutes earlier since it overcooked the edges a little! Can’t get enough of it!

I also added in pumpkin seeds, dried cherries, extra butter, and used ground flax instead of whole. Instead of whole wheat I used a gluten free flour blend. It’s the best tasting loaf to come out of my machine thus far!

I don't have a bread maker, but still turned out great!

I combined all ingredients except flax and sunflower seeds and let proof for about 2 hours. I added flax seeds, millet, and chia seeds and omitted the sunflower seeds for a more consistent texture. I let proof for about 45 more minutes. 

I baked in a floured glass bread pan for 30 minutes at 375. I probably should have let it go for another 5-10 minutes at this temp.
It wasn't great. It was OK. Unfortunately, the recipe didn't tell the temperature to make the bread with.

I did this recipe using my Kitchen Aid. I added an extra 1/3 C flour as suggested by someone else but the dough was still sticky when I transferred it to my pan. The finished product was just fine though. I halved the chia seeds and added 1/4 C pumpkin seeds. The bread was DELICIOUS! I made it twice in one weekend.

Have made this recipe many times with great results every time. First time made it to recipe, perfect. Started experimenting and substituted raisins and dried cranberries for the flax seeds and sunflower seeds, no additional changes to the recipe. That is my Thanksgiving bread. No matter the if it made with seeds or fruit, the taste is fantastic with a soft tender crumb.

Great simple recipe. Made it twice now in my bread maker and only change was to add 1tbsp of vital wheat gluten the second time which resulted in a fluffier less dense loaf. Definitely adding to regular recipe roster.

I love this super light, fluffy, moist, delicious hearty bread! It is nutty with the perfect balance of honeylicious sweetness. Like many reviewers, I do not own a bread machine, so I made it the artisan way, which is always quite fun and extremely satisfying. I also reduced the amounts of sunflower and flax seeds to 1/4 cup each, adapting to my family's tastes and preferences. Additionally, I added 1/4 cup of potato flakes and 2 tablespoons of dry powdered milk. This bread rises incredibly high! I will definitely make it again and again and again!!! :-)
On the advice of others - I increased the yeast by 1/2 teaspoon, increased the salt by 1/4 teaspoon, used ground flax seeds instead of whole, and baked at 350 for 30 minutes.
This is my favorite bread recipe and is packed with protein, which is important when you're on a vegan or vegetarian diet. I make it once a week.

This is seriously the best tasting bread. I use a bread machine and it's our everyday bread. I can't have dairy so I sub out refined coconut oil for the butter and it turns out perfectly every time. The texture is very soft so for spreads like cream cheese etc it needs a heavier toasting to hold up. Stays fresh for about 5 days on the counter and 10 days in the fridge
Did not change anything. Good recipe.
This recipe needs more yeast and more flour. It makes a rather small loaf. It's kind of oily but nutritious tasting bread. I've had better. But I've had worse.
This recipe needs more yeast and more flour. It makes a rather small loaf. It's kind of oily but nutritious tasting bread. I've had better. But I've had worse.
I made this by hand. Very easy to make. I used suggestion on a review to use 2 cups warm water and oil instead of butter and used 1 packet yeast. Proofing 10 minutes. Will make again
Excellent recipe. Followed ingredients as stated. Will try using more sunflower seeds the next time I make it.
Like with any bread, it took a lot of time to let it rise, but other than that, it was great. My husband loved it! The only thing I would do different, is to divide it in fourths, not sixths.

My family and I really enjoyed this bread recipe. I had an opportunity to use some freshly ground hard red wheat berries in place of store bought whole wheat flour, and it turned out beautifully. 
This recipe will be added to my recipe box and used regularly.

This bread is amazing. I followed the recipe exactly and made it in my bread machine. I am so pleased with how light the bread turned out, lovely crust and great flavour. 
It is far superior to the seed recipe that came with my bread machine and this recipe is much simpler. 
Highly recommend.
I enjoy making and eating this bread often., using the bread machine to prepare the dough and baking it in the oven. I use ground flax seed and sometimes add 1/2 cup of dried cranberries.

Recently a big box store quit making a seeded bread that my husband loves. So I invested in a bread machine,; deciding that I would find a recipe that included seeds. I just finished making this loaf, and it is delicious. I did include several seeds to simulate the loaf we could not buy anymore. I was not trying to change the recipe but to duplicate what we could not purchase anymore. Aside from sunflower seeds, I included walnuts, pecans, and pumpkin seeds. It looks, and tastes great. Thank you for submitting.

I bought a bread machine a few months ago and have tried many recipes to find a bread I want to eat every day. This is the one! I had to add some extra flour because the dough was very wet, but I chalk that up to the humidity here. Delicious!

I made this in my bread maker earlier this week but fell asleep before the beep to add in the sunflower seeds. Without the sunflower seeds the recipe is still great. I also followed what some of the reviewers said about using veg oil instead of the butter (we were low on butter and I wanted some to go on the toast I wanted to make with it in the morning). The bread is fluffy and I was able to slice it thin enough for pbj sandwiches without a mess of crumbs. This recipe is going to become our weekly loaf because of how tasty, versatile, and easy it is to make. I used the white bread, 1.5lb setting, with medium crust, and just measured everything into the bread maker and pressed start :) you don't even need special flour, I just used all purpose flour.
I made it as it was. It was delicious, we loved the crunch of the seeds. Will definitely make this again
Easy to prepare. Great flavor.
Delicious!!!!!
Loved the taste and crunchiness of the seeds. One I'll be making many times over.

I've made this recipie a couple of times now. When i followed the original, I didn't get a great rise, so it was a more dense bread. Instead, I used LDSGIRL's variation* and it was absolutely sublime. I also added a half cup unsalted pumpkin seeds.
*2 cups warm water with 6 tbsp honey dissolved, then added 2 1/4 tsp yeast, proofing for 10 minutes. 2 tbsp melted butter and 1.5 tsp salt. 3 cups whole wheat flour and 2 cups bread flour, 1/2 cup ground flax seeds (used a coffee grinder), 1/2 cup unsalted sunflower seeds, and 1/2 cup unsalted pumpkin seeds. Kneaded on low using Kitchen Aid with dough hook for about 10 minutes. Let it rise, covered with a dish cloth, in the microwave with just the hood light on for heat for about an hour. Punched it down, divided into two parts and put into greased loaf pans. Rise for another 45 mins, then bake (in convection oven if possible) at 375 for 30 mins. Perfection!

Fave healthy bread machine recipe ever. Did just as directed except used regular whole wheat, rather than bread flour, and most importantly, used about 2 1/2 tsp yeast (one whole packet) instead of the 1 tsp. called for. Came out lovely and not too dense, like some healthy bread recipes.
My favorite whole wheat bread that I have made.
I loved this recipe! It was a hardy and delicious bread, and I would make it again.

This tastes really good. I just tried a hot piece out of the oven with some butter! I followed "LDSGIRL's" helpful advice and increased the size to get two loaves. The loaves were about as big as the loaf pan, and didn't rise out of the pan like I prefer. If I made this again, I would increase all of the ingredients beyond the helpful review quantities by 25%. This would then yield two nice big loaves. The bread is delicious! One more note, it took me about an hour to completely bake the bread to perfection.

This dense, seed-rich bread is my favorite - year round! I enjoy it warm, right out of the bread machine, but toasted in thick slices - it's heavenly - and my guests always agree! I prefer 1" slices, buttered lightly, and golden toasted in a skillet on the stove. Wrap leftover loaf tight and it will store in the fridge for several weeks. Modifications: I add a smidge (1/4 t.) of yeast and sometimes add 1/4 cup cooked, cooled cracked wheat which necessitates the addition of 1/2 cup flour, more or less. But I'm sure that any failures (insufficient rise) I've had with this recipe are because of yeast quality.

The best bread I have ever made!! Have made the dough regularly EXACTLY as the recipe states and have never had a bad batch. Have baked it in the bread maker and also taken it out and made smaller loaves... the most consistent recipe.

LOVED IT! 
I grind my own wheat ( non gmo) so I add one teaspoon of baking powder per cup of flour. I also added about a tablespoon of chia seeds. 
I live at a high altitude ( about 7,000 ft), so today I'm also adding one of my chickens eggs. 
I have a breadman pro bread machine and was surprised to use the regular white bread setting. My loaf turned out perfectly. Thanks for posting this recipe!
Followed the recipe exactly, but baked it in the oven. Delicious!

I've made this recipe several times. It's long on great texture and a bit short on flavor. So to experiment, I used 3 tbl butter, 1 1/2 tsp salt, 4 tbl honey and because it comes out a little flat, I used 2 1/2 tsp yeast. And I used a bit more water. It was a bit damp after the proof but it shaped up w a little kneading and some sprinkled flour. Because it's more moist, give it the full 35 minutes at 350. I took it out at 30 and it wasn't ready. Success? Closer. I may try molasses instead of honey next time. It certainly rose nicely and the additional butter creates a more moist loaf. Oh, I also used toasted but not salted sunflower seeds. I'm not sure that difference was detectable. I was out of pumpkin seeds. I used half cup flax seeds and half cup sunflower. And a quarter cup quinoa. The flax seeds may be mostly bio unavailable, as one reviewer noted, but I do like the texture difference they offer.
For seed lovers, add an additional 1/2 cup of pumpkin seeds to really set this bread off! Turned out excellent!

Best bread ever! We use this recipe ALL the time in our house and it is great! Love the texture and taste and healthy appeal.
I don't understand why people are having a hard time (16 hours to make the bread? what? LOL). Make sure to use warm water and add the salt in separate from the yeast. I like to use the light crust setting on this one. YUMMY!!!!
I followed the most helpful positive review and it came out perfect! Thank you! Will definitely do it again and again!

This was the easiest recipe I've ever used. I love how the machine literally did ever after I put the ingredients in and then the seeds when the first timer went off. The bread came out delicious and perfect. I will definitely keep using this recipe. Thanks Erna =)
I made this in a bread machine and it was AMAZING!!! Deliciously chewy. I used olive oil instead of butter and maple syrup instead of honey to make if vegan. I will definitely make this again.
One of the best bread recipes ever.
An excellent hearty bread!
This bread turned out amazing! So soft and delicious. I used ground flax and substituted pumpkin seeds for sunflower seeds because that's what I had in the house.
This is a fabulous, dense wheat bread with a great texture with the sunflower seeds. Very hearty! Came out perfectly in my bread machine maker. FYI - I used milled flax seed.
Very tasty and great texture. Next time will try it 100% whole wheat.
Love how moist and tasty this bread is. I used whole package of dry active yeast the rest of the recipe I kept the same.

We really enjoyed this bread. I am a huge fan of sunflower seeds so I was hoping this would be good. The recipe did not disappoint me. I did increase the yeast to 1 1/2 tsp. Since I have ground flax seeds, that is what I used. I also used white whole wheat flour. Next time I want to add some pumpkin seeds and some old fashioned oats. I love the nutty texture of this bread and it slices nicely. Thank you for sharing this recipe Erna Walmsley.

This was a pretty good wheat bread recipe. I had everything, but had to sub flaxmeal for the seeds . That worked fine. I am just not a fan of the seeds whole. I also used white whole wheat. My sunflower seeds were unsalted and roasted. For some reason the bread machine recipes never suggest warm water. Out of habit I used warm water, and about 105~110 degrees. On the cycle, suggested, it took 3 hrs and 25 minutes in my Zojirushi bread machine. This bread tasted like whole wheat bread and had that healthy flavor. However, it was soft and had an almost buttery aftertaste. Cutting it with my Presto bread guide I got 17 slices at 129 calories each.
Came out beautifully!! I used agave nectar and ground flax.I also added a tablespoon full of chia seeds.

I baked it in the oven after the machine did all the kneading and rising; I may have underbaked it, but won't know for sure until it cools and we get closer to the center of the loaf, but the dough came together beautifully without interference and rose excellently for the right amount of lift to the dense chewiness of the whole-wheat-ness and the seeds.

Made this for the first time today, and WOW is it yummy! I didn't have "bread flours" but used all purpose and wheat flours. When the bread machine signaled it was time to add the sunflower seeds, I was worried because the dough seemed SO sticky that it was having a hard time even moving the ball of dough around. I helped it along for a minute or so after I first put added the sunflower seeds, but eventually said "forget it" and decided to let it do its thing. It somehow worked out, and created a beautiful, rich loaf. This bread TOASTED is like heaven on earth. YUM! Will definitely make this over and over again.

I searched for many months for a recipe like this! I have bought this type of bread from the grocery store before and it is always one of my favorites. I am so happy that I found this recipe! I have made it several times now and it always turns out perfect! 

Now I am searching for the perfect rye bread recipe. This recipe seems to be the perfect combination of flour, liquid and oil. I like how it turns out soft but hearty. So, I plan to try this recipe but change it up for rye bread. Instead of all the whole wheat flour I plan to use 2/3 cup of rye flour and 2/3 cup of whole wheat. I'll add a teaspoon of caraway seeds in place of sunflower seeds. Instead of honey I'll use molasses. Hoping it turns out right.
This is my favorite bread recipe I've found on this site so far. I am a huge fan of sunflower seeds so i may be a tad bias.

Excellent! This recipe just replaced our $5/week Good Seed habit! I didn't have wheat flour, so I substituted AP white flour for it, and used bread flour as was called for. Everything else stayed the same (added a pinch more salt per several suggestions) and this bread is AWESOME! Light, fluffy (let it rise total of 3 hrs between punches) and it's not even cool yet, and is already 3/4 gone!

This was my first attempt at making bread in my breadmaker, and it turned out to be one fabulous first bread@! Used roasted unsalted sunflower seeds. Set breadmaker for dough; my breadmaker instructions say to put these in at the start of the 2nd knead cycle, which was 30 minutes into the dough process. Let it rise in a greased loaf pan and baked at 350 for 25 minutes. PERFECTO! We changed what we were eating for dinner so we could have this bread with it. We are in love with this bread and will be making it again. I know it will also be great as toast with jam on it~ Thanks for a great recipe!
By the way, my grocery didn't have whole wheat bread flour available, so I just used regular bread flour for the whole amount of flour - no problem. Did not change any of the other ingredients - perfect as is.
I made this once. It was okay.

Very good! I have made this a few times now. I accidentally used milled flax instead of just flax seeds and it was so much better and moist than the "correct" version. Although both versions were good, I think I will stick with the milled flax from now on.

I modified another bread machine recipe to something almost exactly like this recipe (even before I found this one). I like making the dough in the machine and baking the bread in the oven. For the most recent loaf, I subbed molasses for the honey for a richer flavor. I also cut the dough into 3 pieces, rolled out into "snakes," and braided them together. Takes a little longer to bake (closer to 50-60 minutes) but very pretty.

This bread is so good. I increased the water to 1 1/2C. and added 1/2 c. chopped sliced almonds, 2T. sesame seeds. 2T. Poppy seeds and 2T. Steel cut oats and 3 T. old fashioned oats. I inceassed the yeast to 2 1/2 t. Better then all the store bought multigrain breads.

this is my all time favorite bread. I did't have sunflower seeds so I used ground up almonds once and used chopped pecans the next time. I also used flax oil instead of butter. Make sure you grind up whole flax seeds. i used my electric coffee grinder. I rate this as a 10 plus!
Excellent great rolls

I made this recipe exactly as written. Neither my husband nor I enjoyed it at all. I really do not have anything good to say about it. It tasted super healthy, bland, almost a little bit tart with the flax seeds.
This bread was hearty yet not dense. LOVED it!
This is the best bread recipe, even better than the ones that come with our machine. My hubby said it was his favorite.

Excellent, I used 9g fresh yeast and did it by hand, not in the breadmaker. I let it rise until doubled, then punched it down and put it in a greased loaf pan, let it rise again and baked for 35min at 375F, it turned out fantastic, excellent texture and taste :)
This is a super good recipe. I've made it twice and it has been gobbled up quickly. I made it just as the directions state and it turned out great!

This bread is FANTASTIC! I just bought my Zojirushi and this was the second bread I've ever made. I did it from start to finish in the machine and it turned out great. I was debating the whole time whether I wanted to finish it in the oven, but now I'm glad I didn't because I honestly don't think it needed it. The texture wasn't like typical bread machine breads. This bread had an awesome thin, flaky crust, and the texture of the bread itself was really light. The sunflower seeds add a delicious, nutty flavor to the whole thing. A few minor substitutions, instead of the flaxseeds I used 1/4 cup flax meal for nutrients, although I did toss a tbs or two of whole flaxseeds because I like the crunch. I also added 1/4 cup King Arthur fiber, and some KA whole grain improver. I ran out of bread flour so I had to use all purpose, it still tasted great though. I added a little bit of KA 6 grain flakes for added flavor and texture. As per so many recommendations here, I used canola oil instead of butter. This really turned out great and I would highly recommend. I even gave this to my (honest) chef father who doesn't typically like wheat or "healthy" type breads, and he even loved it. We buy multigrain bread at the grocery store to have as toast for breakfast every day, but this has totally replaced that. I'm so happy to have such a great recipe and know exactly what is going in my bread, definitely no preservatives!
This bread was ok. I made mistake of adding sunflower seeds at wrong time and instead of them mixing in they just stayed on top. Which may have caused bread to sink in.
So so yummy and filling!
Our most used bread maker recipe!

I was searching for a home-made (more budget-friendly) version of "Dave's Bread," which costs $5 a loaf in the natural foods department at the local grocery. This recipe comes pretty darn close to hitting the mark on the first try! (Thank you to creator Erna Walmsley & the folks who have commented.) I do not have a bread machine, but used my kitchen-aid stand mixer and my oven. I followed the comments by other All-Recipe members also:
1) dissolve 6T honey in 2c water, pour 1/2 into your mixer bowl & then sprinkle the yeast on water...wait for proof before adding the remaining water
2) mixed flours, & salt (& #3 additions) in separate bowl and then added by cup-full to running mixer
3) *I added 1/2 c rough-chopped oats, 1/4 c fine-ground almonds, 1/4 c wheat germ
4) mix thoroughly, add the butter/oil blend (abt 1/4 c)
5) added = amounts of the following seeds: flax seed, sunflower seed, & toasted sesame seed... save some to sprinkle on outside of loaf
6) knead in mixer, then remove to oiled bowl to rise for an hour. 
7) Punch down, cut in 1/2, re-shape & pat remaining seed mixture (added a little wheat-germ to outside seed mix) then placed shaped loaf into greased & floured baking vessel. 
8) allow to rise another 1/2 hr, score top with a knife, and brush top with melted butter
9) bake @ 400 for about 25 min
10) remove & allow temp to drop before removing from pan to a cooling rack --or to a cutting board because this is the best time to taste-test!
Enjoy! ~K

Love this Bread! Since I didn't have any whole wheat bread flour, I used the regular bread flour and white whole wheat flour I had, and added 2 TBSP of vital wheat gluten. It rose beautifully and came out great. Thanks for the recipe, Erna!

I've made this bread twice now and it keeps coming out flat. I don't blame the recipe though, because I've been using ground flax and I think that it's binding everything together too much (intact flax seeds don't have the same "binding/egg-like" properties as ground flax). It tastes really good though. I just wanted to warn people not to sub in ground flax because I think it's preventing my bread from rising properly :(
Mmmmm. Thank you. It also keeps pretty well. I used the white whole wheat flour
Mmmmm. Thank you. It also keeps pretty well. I used the white whole wheat flour

Scrumptious, hearty, healthy bread! This is a great recipe. One thing I did was substitute whole wheat bread flour with rolled oats. I did so because I was out of whole wheat bread flour, but I must say that it was an excellent substitution and gave even more texture and taste. Yum!

Great recipe! I used pumpkin seeds in place of sunflower seeds (because it was what I had on hand), and vegetable oil in place of butter. Made without a bread machine by proofing the yeast in warm water, mixing on high speed for ~3 minutes with a Kitchen-Aid paddle to develop the gluten, and then kneading with the dough hook for ~8 minutes on low speed. Made a tender, flavorful, hearty loaf.
